cabra
Class UserData

java.lang.Object
  cabra.UserData

public final class UserData
extends java.lang.Object

An uninstantiable class for user info

Author:
Neel

Method Detail

getString

public static java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String key)
Returns the String data stored with the given key.

Parameters:
key - the key associated with the data.
Returns:
the text of the datum associated with the key.

getInt

public static int getInt(java.lang.String key)
Same as getString(), except it converts the string to an int for you.

Parameters:
key - the key associated with the data
Returns:
the int of the datum associated with the key

setString

public static void setString(java.lang.String key,
                             java.lang.String value)
Sets the data for the datum at the given key.

Parameters:
key - the key with which to find the datum
value - the value to give the new datum.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if it can't find the key you passed

makeDefault

public static void makeDefault(java.lang.String key)
Makes the datum at the given key revert to its default data value.

Parameters:
key - the key with which to get a datum and set its data to default.

getPref

public static java.lang.String getPref(java.lang.String pref)
Gets the String data from the given preference. Just a convenience wrapper around getString().

Parameters:
pref - the preference's name, such as FontSize. Technically the Datum is Prefs.FontSize; this is a wrapper.

getIntPref

public static int getIntPref(java.lang.String pref)
Returns the int data from the given preference.

Parameters:
pref - the preference's name, such as FontSize.
Returns:
the preference's value as an int

setPref

public static void setPref(java.lang.String pref,
                           java.lang.String value)
Sets the data for the preference at the given key.

Parameters:
pref - the pref's key; "Prefs." is added to the front
value - the value for the preference

makeAllDefault

public static void makeAllDefault()
Resets all user data to its default settings. Only use this if all data is corrupted.

load

public static void load()
Loads user data.

writeLine

public static <E> void writeLine(java.io.BufferedWriter writer,
                                 cabra.UserData.Datum<E> datum)
Writes a line of user data.

Parameters:
writer - a BufferedWriter that will be writing
datum - a datum of any kind
